The Birth Story of Mayha (Mayha’s Birth Story)
“The bird called Mayha,
who roams the mountain slopes and valleys,
having climbed a ripe pipphali fruit,
cries out ‘Mayha, mayha!’
While he is lamenting like this,

In the same way, here someone
having accumulated much wealth,
does not use it for himself or his relatives,
but spends it as he gets it.
He does not enjoy clothes or food,
or garlands or ointments;
he does not enjoy anything at all,
and does not support his relatives.
While he is lamenting like this,
guarding ‘Mayha, mayha!’
kings or thieves,
or those who are not dear to him,
take his wealth and go away,
while he laments.
But a wise man, having obtained wealth,
supports his relatives;
he gains a good reputation,
and after death rejoices in heaven.”
